column4: i just downloaded xfce.. during install my oc got shutdown... how do i search for the xfce file i downloaded n then install it ??
with apt-get? or with a browser?
i told you 10 times, you pc will even crash with xfce4

i used apt get.. it downloaded packages for xfce.. but it got shutdown during install... where can i find the xfce to install since it is already dwnloaded...plus... now i see two terminals under applications... one is the normal .. and the other shows terminal emulator..whats dat?
also you want xubuntu-desktop and not xfce4
it sasys /var/cache/apt/archives is a directory in shells.. how do i install it from shells? what commands??
sudo apt-get install xubuntu-desktop    should use the already cached packages, restwill be downloaded
and i promise your pc will crash with xfce4 or even only cli, because if you start a program its using the cpu and because of the broken fan, the pc will crash
so dont waste your time with installing xfce4 or other stuff
can i manually clean fan myself? or send laptop to manufacturer?
